name: hydroponically
content:

using hydroponics (= a method of growing plants in water, sand, or gravel (= very small stones) to which liquid chemical plant foods are added, rather than growing them in earth): If astronauts grow their own food on a space station, they'll do it hydroponically. Fresh herbs, often hydroponically grown in greenhouses, are sold in bunches.
More examplesFewer examplesWe've started growing watercress and lettuce hydroponically.There is no soil involved; the plants are fed hydroponically, drawing minerals and water from a trough.The roots of hydroponically produced fruits and vegetables hang in direct contact with water.
